repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: Transcriptions of Tamil inscriptions by Ariel, bound in one volume.
Various papers of various format, pasted (f2-f8) or hinged in the volume (f9-f27). Contains also drawings.
The inscriptions were copied at Villiyaṉūr, Tiṇṭivaṉam (?), Tiruvaṇṭārkōyil, Tiruvakkarai.

The volume contains:
f1.1-f1.2: title page and drawings.
f2: transcription in Tamil script of 2 inscriptions. The first of the two is from Villiyaṉūr (that is, Pondicherry Inscriptions n0. 411, p. 365).
f3-f6: transcription in Tamil script of inscriptions from Tiṇṭivaṉam (?). Numbered "1" to "4" in black pencile on top left side of page.
f7: transcription in Tamil script of an inscription from Tiruvaṇṭārkōyil (that is, Pondicherry Inscriptions n0. 51, p. 63).
f8-f18: drawings of walls and bases with eye-copies of Tamil inscriptions.
f19-f20: drawings.
f21-f26: drawings of walls and bases with eye-copies of Tamil inscriptions.
f27: drawings on the recto and notes on the verso (about an inscription in Tiruvakkarai).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 2 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Elements of library binding.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Element of original bundle.
28 folios = Ariel Papers: Tamil Inscriptions. Library Arabic foliation 1, 1bis, 2-27. f1 and f1bis are in fact a single folio folded in two and foliated "1-1bis" (indicated below as f1.1 and f1.2).
2 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Elements of library binding.

decoNote.desc:
Various drawings (presumably by Édouard Ariel):
an Indian man, in turban, with an umbrella, with a hookah (?) on a table (f1.1v-f1.2r)
the bust of a European lady, with a signature or label (damaged or deliberately erased?) (f1.2r)
a puppet (f1.2r)
a female head ( f9r)
a liṅga and a liṅgodbhavamūrti (f19r)
a ṛṣabha (f19v)
a temple devakoṣṭha of Kali, with two naked ladies flanking it (f20r)
a machine (?) (f20v)
2 ladies, architectural elements of a church (?) (f27r)

additions.desc: Title printed on the spine: INSCRIPTIONS DE VILLENOUR.
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 964 (front cover, verso).
BnF shelfmark in black ink: Indien 964 (f[1]r).
Title in black ink: Inscriptions de Villenour (f[1]r).

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outer faces.

origin.origDate: Some parts (f2r) internally dated to June 5th, 1849 CE.

provenance.p: Autograph work by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192. Borrowed by Julien Vinson and returned, August 13th, 1932, to the BnF (see Cabaton 1912).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See handwritten addition in BnF copy (shelfmark “8°-Impr Or-720”), f3v, no. 964.
Pondicherry Inscriptions. Part I. Introduction and Texts with Notes. Compiled by Bahour S. Kuppusamy. Edited Dr. G. Vijayavenugopal. Pondicherry: IFP & EFEO, 2006.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
